about.name: I'm Nive!
about.tagline: Engineer, AI builder, MBA candidate, and Mom.
about.bio:
_Structural Engineer_ → _NYU Stern MBA (Business Analytics, Strategy, Technology Product Management)_
---
I started my career as a Structural Engineer, designing and managing water infrastructure systems that quietly keep entire cities running. What drew me to engineering back then is still true today: I love breaking down complexity, making sense of data, and building systems that work in the real world.
In 2023, I began my MBA at **NYU Stern**, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management. That’s where my curiosity for AI really took off. I became fascinated by how engineering logic, product thinking, and data-driven decision-making come together to create smarter, more resilient organizations.
Since then, I’ve worked on projects ranging from AI-powered product design and climate-tech pricing models to construction-tech strategy and machine learning workflows. Across every space, one thing stays the same: I love turning ambiguity into structure, and structure into solutions people actually use.
Motherhood has added an unexpected and meaningful layer to my journey. Balancing a full-time career, graduate school, and raising a tiny human taught me resilience, empathy, and the power of small, consistent progress. It changed how I lead, how I build, and what I value in the work I choose to do.
Outside of work, you’ll find me baking something sweet, hiking with my family, or inventing new toddler activities for my son. You’ll also find me experimenting with AI tools and side projects — anything that blends curiosity with creativity and makes everyday life a little smarter or more joyful.
---
about.tldr:
### _**tl;dr**_
_I design water systems by day, build AI tools by night, and chase a toddler in between._
_If there’s a messy business problem, I’ll break it down._
_If there’s data, I’ll analyze it._
_And if there’s an opportunity to use AI to make life easier, I’m already building it._
---

projects.title: Email Summarizer using n8n
projects.subtitle: Automated weekly digest of top emails with AI
projects.overview:
### **Overview**
A fully automated email intelligence agent that reads the top 50 emails each week, extracts themes, action items, and reminders, and sends a structured summary to the user.
---
### **Problem**
Professionals spend hours triaging inboxes, often missing critical to-dos hidden inside long threads. A lightweight, automated summarizer can dramatically reduce cognitive load and improve task prioritization.---
### **Architecture Diagram (High-Level RAG Pipeline)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Cron[Weekly Cron Trigger] --> Gmail["Fetch 50 Emails"]
Gmail --> LLM["OpenAI Summarizer"]
LLM --> Organizer["Categorize: Highlights / To-Dos / Reminders"]
Organizer --> EmailNode[Email Sender]
EmailNode --> User
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- n8n
- Gmail API
- GPT models
- Cron schedules
- Email node (SMTP)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Avoiding invented tasks ("hallucinated action items")
- Handling duplicate content in long threads
- Designing summaries that work on mobile
- Ensuring reliable weekly execution
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design multi-step agentic workflows
- How prompt engineering affects action-item extraction
- How to balance completeness and brevity
- How to deliver recurring automation with reliability
---

projects.title: FEMA Companion
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
### *Overview* A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) tool that makes **FEMA P-750** and **NIST GCR 2016** seismic design guidelines fully searchable. The system enables engineers to ask natural-language questions and receive precise, citation-backed answers. --- ### **Problem** Seismic codes are dense, technical, and difficult to navigate. Engineers spend significant time manually searching hundreds of pages, often missing important clauses. No existing solution provides fast, authoritative, clause-level lookup grounded directly in source documents. --- ### **Architecture Diagram (High-Level RAG Pipeline)** ```mermaid flowchart LR A[User] --> B[Query Handler] B --> C[Vector Search] C --> D["Document Chunks
(FEMA / NIST)"] D --> E[Embeddings] E --> F[LLM Reasoning] F --> G["Final Answer
+ Citations"] ``` --- ### **Tech Stack** - LangChain - ChromaDB - OpenAI embeddings - GPT models - Python / Streamlit - PDF parsing with `pypdf` --- ### **Key Challenges** - Designing chunk sizes for technical engineering text - Preventing LLM hallucinations with strict grounding constraints - Ensuring consistent citation mapping - Handling mixed-format engineering documents --- ### **What I Learned** - How to build a complete RAG system end-to-end - How retrieval quality affects answer accuracy and trustworthiness - How to design usable AI tools for domain experts - How to enforce accuracy and grounding in engineering workflows ---

projects.title: ParentPal – Custom GPT
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
### *Overview*
ParentPal is an empathetic, safety-aligned AI parenting assistant grounded entirely in HealthyChildren.org (American Academy of Pediatrics). It delivers reliable, age-appropriate guidance for new parents.
---
### **Problem**
Parents are overwhelmed by contradictory online information. They need trusted, source-based advice—and AI models require strict guardrails to avoid unsafe recommendations.---
Architecture Diagram (Custom GPT with Safety Layer)
```mermaid
flowchart LR
User --> GPT[Custom GPT]
GPT --> Rules["System Prompt: Safety + AAP-only Sources"]
Rules --> Healthy[HealthyChildren.org Articles]
Healthy --> GPT
GPT --> User
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- OpenAI Custom GPT builder
- Safety guardrails + structured prompts
- HealthyChildren.org
- Retrieval constraints
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Enforcing strict guardrails for medical-adjacent topics
- Designing empathetic yet factual responses
- Ensuring citations map to approved AAP content
- Maintaining consistency across age groups
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI for safety-critical domains
- How to structure system prompts with constraints
- How to build trust through transparency
- How empathy shapes UX in family-oriented tools
---

projects.title: SalesSense AI
projects.subtitle: Real-time sales intelligence agent (RAG + automation)
projects.overview:
### **Overview**
A RAG-powered AI agent that analyzes sales files, embeds them into a vector database, and enables conversational analysis of KPIs, performance trends, and competitor insights.
---
### **Problem**
Sales ops teams deal with scattered PDFs, Excel files, and decks. Answering even basic questions about growth or retention requires time-consuming manual work.
### **Architecture Diagram (Sales RAG System)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Drive Folder] --> B[n8n Ingestion Pipeline]
B --> C[Embedding Pipeline]
C --> D[Vector DB]
D --> E[LLM Answer Engine]
E --> F[Chat UI]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Python
- n8n automation
- Pinecone
- LangChain
- GPT models
- Streamlit UI
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Normalizing unstructured sales files
- Ensuring accurate KPI extraction
- Updating embeddings as new files arrive
- Avoiding hallucinations when data is missing
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to operationalize data ingestion for business users
- How RAG behaves with structured vs. unstructured data
- How to design explainability into business AI tools
- How to balance transparency with speed
---

projects.title: Understand AI
projects.subtitle: Meeting memory assistant (RAG + reasoning AI)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Understand.AI is an AI-powered meeting memory system built for software engineering teams. It provides fast recall of decisions, rationale, action items, and historical context by unifying transcripts, Slack threads, and notes into a single searchable intelligence layer. The system is designed to help engineers spend less time digging through fragmented documentation and more time building.
### **Problem**
Engineering teams lose hours each week trying to remember what was decided and where context lives. Information is scattered across Confluence, Jira, Slack, raw recordings, and personal notes—causing rework, misalignment, and slowed execution. Teams need a trusted, centralized memory with timestamps, decision history, and explanation paths so they can retrieve context instantly.
### **Tech Stack**
- Claude AI (reasoning & summarization)
- ChatGPT (generation, correction, refinement)
- Loavable (AI workflow + orchestration)
- Vector search (semantic retrieval)
- Meeting transcription (audio → text)
- Figma prototypes (UX flows, interaction design)
- Knowledge Graph (entity + decision linking, conceptual)
### **Key Challenges**
- Building trust through timestamps, source snippets, and uncertainty indicators
- Designing an intuitive search experience that returns context quickly without overwhelming the user
- Handling long transcripts while surfacing only the decisions, rationales, blockers, and action items
- Balancing summary clarity vs. completeness for engineering audiences
- Creating product-led growth loops for cross-team adoption in large orgs (e.g., shareable AI summaries)
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI products specifically for developer workflows and cognitive patterns
- How trust signals (citations, timestamps, transcript excerpts, correction interfaces) dramatically improve adoption
- How to convert raw user pain points into validated UX flows through rapid prototyping
- How PLG motions differ between engineering tools and consumer AI products
- How to shape an AI product around reliability, transparency, and low-friction recall

resume.summary: Engineer-turned-strategist with 7+ years of experience designing complex infrastructure systems and building AI-enabled products. Combines structural engineering rigor with business analytics, product thinking, and hands-on AI development. Currently completing an MBA at NYU Stern, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management.
skills: Business & Strategy (MBA Coursework): Strategy, Operations Management, Tech Product Management, Digital Strategy, Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting, Marketing, Leadership, Negotiation, Decision Models

AI & Product Management: AI/LLM Systems, RAG, Custom GPTs, AI Agents, Prompt Engineering, Product Discovery, User Research, Product Roadmapping, MVP Scoping, Competitive Analysis, KPI Design, LangChain, Streamlit, n8n Automation, ChromaDB, Pinecone
Data & Analytics: SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Python, R Studio, Excel, MATLAB, C++, Statistics, Data Visualization, Digital Marketing Analytics, AI Applications in Business
Structural Engineering & Technical: STAAD Pro, RAM, ETABS, ANSYS, RISA-3D, AutoCAD, Revit, MicroStation, BIM, ENERCALC, SAP2000, MathCAD, ACI/AISC/ASCE Standards, QA/QC
experience: Structural Engineer — Carollo Engineers | Designed & managed multimillion-dollar water infrastructure projects; led cross-discipline coordination, construction support, and QA workflows; built dashboards and analytics tools used by design leadership; improved design review cycle time through data-driven process improvements.

Graduate Projects | NYU Stern School of Business; **Understand.AI — AI Meeting Memory Product* ; - Designed LLM-powered meeting intelligence system; - Conducted user research & validation with engineering teams; - Built UX flows, trust features, and product strategy; **Tao Climate — Carbon Removal Pricing Strategy* ; - Developed pricing strategy for hemp-based carbon credits; - Modeled airline willingness-to-pay & competitive positioning; - Presented recommendations at Google NY; **Morningstar — Climate Index Strategy* ; - Built index methodology using Sustainalytics ESG data; - Modeled climate-aligned weighting scheme
education: MBA — Business Analytics, Strategy, Tech Product Management | NYU Stern School of Business (2023–2026)
MS — Structural/Environmental Engineering | Arizona State University

contact.title: Let's Connect
contact.body:
I'm always excited to connect with people working on innovative products, AI applications, and big strategic challenges.
I also enjoy supporting others on similar journeys. I regularly mentor students interested in engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or navigating early-career decisions. I love helping early-stage startups brainstorm ideas, and I support mission-driven teams and NGOs whenever possible.
If you’d like to chat, explore mentorship, or simply brainstorm, I’d be happy to connect — I’m usually available on weekends.
Looking forward to what's ahead — and grateful that our paths have crossed.
